Introduction ¶

The code below is all you need to get started with single CouchDB database.

var couchdb = require("couchdb-api");

/** default values: "localhost", 5984 **/
var server = couchdb.srv(host, port);

var db = server.db("my-database");

Information ¶

GET /db official documentation

Returns basic meta information about the database.

db.info(function (err, response) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Create ¶

PUT /db official documentation

Creates the database with the same name as the one specified in this object.

db.create(function (err, result) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Drop ¶

DELETE /db official documentation

Creates the database with the same name as the one specified in this object.

db.create(function (err, result) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Changes Feed ¶

GET /db/_changes official documentation

Query the database's _changes feed.

Additional Arguments *

name data type comments
query object Querystring parameters to add to the request uri.
(see CouchDB documentation for specifics)

* callback is always assumed to be the last argument. See this page for more details regarding callbacks.

// this is only a small subset of possible querystring values
//    see the official API documentation for further details
var query = {
	feed:         "normal", // default
	include_docs: false     // default
};

db.changes(query, function (err, log) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Compact ¶

POST /db/_compact, POST /db/_compact/ddoc official documentation

Run a compaction on the database itself, or the view indexes for a specified design document.

Additional Arguments *

name data type comments
ddoc string Optional A design document to compact

* callback is always assumed to be the last argument. See this page for more details regarding callbacks.

// compact the whole database
db.compact(function (err, result) {
	// your code here...
});

// compact only this design document
db.compact("my-design-doc", function (err, result) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

View Cleanup ¶

POST /db/_view_cleanup official documentation

Ensure Full Commit ¶

POST /db/_ensure_full_commit official documentation

Forces all recent writes to be written to disk immediately.

db.ensureFullCommit(function (err, result) {
	// your code here...
});
Back to Top

Document ¶

Retrieves a Document object within the database's namespace.

// if you already know your document's _id
var doc = db.doc("my-doc-id");

// if you are creating a new document (without an _id specified)
var doc = db.doc();
